com.linecorp.armeria.server

Interface ServiceInvocationHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DecoratingServiceInvocationHandler, TracingServiceInvocationHandler
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ServiceInvocationHandler
    Handles the invocation request decoded by a ServiceCodec.
    See Also:
    Service

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <T extends ServiceInvocationHandler>
      Optional<T>      		 as(Class<T> handlerType)
      Undecorates this ServiceInvocationHandler to find the ServiceInvocationHandler which is an instance of the specified handlerType.
      default void handlerAdded(ServiceConfig cfg)
      Invoked when the Service of this ServiceInvocationHandler has been added to a Server with the specified configuration.
      void invoke(ServiceInvocationContext ctx, Executor blockingTaskExecutor, Promise<Object> promise)
      Handles the invocation request and finishes the specified promise with its result.

    • Method Detail

      • handlerAdded

        default void handlerAdded(ServiceConfig cfg)
                   throws Exception
        Invoked when the Service of this ServiceInvocationHandler has been added to a Server with the specified configuration. Please note that this method can be invoked more than once if the Service has been added more than once.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • invoke

        void invoke(ServiceInvocationContext ctx,
            Executor blockingTaskExecutor,
            Promise<Object> promise)
     throws Exception
        Handles the invocation request and finishes the specified promise with its result.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ServiceInvocationContext that provides the information about the invocation
        blockingTaskExecutor - an Executor to use when this handler has to perform a task that would block the current thread
        promise - the Promise of the invocation, which is expected to be marked as done once
        Throws:
        Exception

      • as

        default <T extends ServiceInvocationHandler> Optional<T> as(Class<T> handlerType)
        Undecorates this ServiceInvocationHandler to find the ServiceInvocationHandler which is an instance of the specified handlerType. Use this method instead of an explicit downcast since most ServiceInvocationHandlers are decorated via Service.decorate(Function) or Service.decorateHandler(Function) and thus cannot be downcast. For example: 
        
 Service s = new MyService().decorate(LoggingService::new).decorate(AuthService::new);
 MyServiceHandler c1 = s.handler().as(MyServiceHandler.class);
 LoggingServiceHandler c2 = s.handler().as(LoggingServiceHandler.class);
 AuthServiceHandler c3 = s.handler().as(AuthServiceHandler.class);
        Parameters:
        handlerType - the type of the desired ServiceInvocationHandler
        Returns:
        the ServiceInvocationHandler which is an instance of handlerType if this ServiceInvocationHandler decorated such a ServiceInvocationHandler. Optional.empty() otherwise.
